Australia: English navigator John Daniel on the New London charted the west coast of Australia, including Rottnest Island and the Wallabi Group of the Houtman Abrolhos.
Chile: By royal decree, the Atacama desert is declared to be the border between the Captain-Generalship of Chile and the Viceroyalty of Peru.
Russia: Russo-Turkish War (1676–1681): The war ended with the Treaty of Bakhchisarai. The Russo-Turkish border was settled at the Dnieper River.
Taiwan: Zheng Jing dies and his son Zheng Kezang succeeds him, only to be ousted by Zheng Keshuang
USA: The Province of Pennsylvania was founded by William Penn.
